noun.description: A machine, especially one powered by electricity or internal combustion, that supplies motive power for a vehicle or for some other device with moving parts.

adjective.description: Giving, imparting, or producing motion or action.
examples: demand is the principle motor force governing economic activity

verb.description: Travel in a motor vehicle, typically a car or a boat.
examples: we motored along a narrow road
we motored out of Breton Bay to begin our return trip down the Potomac

origin: Late Middle English (denoting a person who imparts motion): from Latin, literally mover, based on movere to move. The current sense of the noun dates from the mid 19th century.
